Articles.Content:
oh yes, yes, yes...

569 kB/s yes ^^

can I have some of you kB/s I'm getting B/s

can I have some of you kB/s I'm getting B/s

If I could, I would.

OK, let's fire up this baby...
Here, have some of mine:
Can anyone who has had the sound and physics "skipping" issue confirm or deny that the issue persists in this version?
Just watched the trailer. Did I just witness the creation of the Space Kraken?

Here, have some of mine:

You're stuck in a particularly tight verbliebend.

Yeah I'm getting 40 KB/s here...I tried starting some extra downloads hoping maybe I'd get another mirror or something, but nope. I also tried the patcher, but it would only patch up to 0.21. Not sure I want to transfer my account to Steam yet, but this is ridiculous.

Just watched the trailer. Did I just witness the creation of the Space Kraken?

I strongly suspect that you are right!

The patcher is now properly set up on the server side, and updating to 0.22 with it should now be possible.

Cheers

Just watched the trailer. Did I just witness the creation of the Space Kraken?

I noticed that too. Almost got Ninja'd by you there! So amusing that their worse nightmare is their own creation...

The patcher is now properly set up on the server side, and updating to 0.22 with it should now be possible.

Cheers

Out of nowhere. Alright time to try the patcher again. Thanks.
*Hugs HarvesteR*

I am happy to report that my saves are functional. I've visited one space station and the hitchiker pods are now represented by pods in actions. You can report stuff if you right click them.

KSC looks awesome. Still exploring, but this seems really good so far. Yippie for Squad!

lol, Steam didn't even mention an update, just did the checking cache and it validated a missing file, giving me the new science stuff, woot!

Quick question for devs, how exactly does the science tree work for parts mods? I noticed my mods like crew manifest and RBR seem to be working fine, but no hide nor hair of KW AEIS or even mechjeb. They only sandbox?

Regardless, still awesome update, thanks! XD

Edited October 16, 2013 by Gaiabladegold
forgot something

Well I'm quite glad that it was night during my first test launch in 0.22.

The new lighting at KSC looks amazing: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=186489583

Cant get the patcher to work, it has been working every time why now??????????? :'(

rsync asked for authentication, responding...

rsync: connection unexpectedly closed (0 bytes received so far) [Receiver]

rsync error: error in rsync protocol data stream (code 12) at /home/lapo/package/rsync-3.0.9-1/src/rsync-3.0.9/io.c(605) [Receiver=3.0.9]

rsync exited with code 12: Error in rsync protocol data stream

EDIT: Some reason my router was blocking the patcher lol, it is working now

Edited October 16, 2013 by Lions
It did that for me the first time, try again a few times, it'll work eventually.
You should have switched to steam. Had the game first minute:)
Aaaaand the servers are now dead.
Server crash... download stopped, unable to restart.
What size is the finished download? I think I've just had it screw up on me. Was so close, then it suddenly finished suspiciously quickly.
Damn, launching at night is pretty!

Warning: mysql_connect(): Too many connections in /host/www.kerbalspaceprogram.com/htdocs/lib/database.php on line 4

MySQL connect failed. Too many connections

The state the island airstrip is in makes me kind of sad.

But these new hangars are perfect to test the vertical maneuverability of a craft ... this treacherous cliff.
I was at 85% when the server crashed
